013package org.apache.juneau.rest.servlet;
014
015import static java.util.logging.Level.*;
016import static jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
020
021import java.io.*;
022import java.text.*;
023import java.util.concurrent.atomic.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025import java.util.logging.*;
026
027import jakarta.servlet.*;
028import jakarta.servlet.http.*;
029
030import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.rest.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.http.response.*;
036
037/**
038 * Servlet implementation of a REST resource.
039 *
040 * <p>
041 *    The {@link RestServlet} class is the entry point for your REST resources.
042 *    It extends directly from <l>HttpServlet</l> and is deployed like any other servlet.
043 * </p>
044 * <p>
045 *    When the servlet <l>init()</l> method is called, it triggers the code to find and process the <l>@Rest</l>
046 *    annotations on that class and all child classes.
047 *    These get constructed into a {@link RestContext} object that holds all the configuration
048 *    information about your resource in a read-only object.
049 * </p>
050 *
051 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
052 *    <li class='note'>
053 *       Users will typically extend from {@link BasicRestServlet} or {@link BasicRestServletGroup}
054 *       instead of this class directly.
055 * </ul>
056 *
057 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
058 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#jrs.AnnotatedClasses">@Rest-Annotated Classes</a>
059 * </ul>
060 *
061 * @serial exclude
062 */
063public abstract class RestServlet extends HttpServlet {
064
065   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
066
067   private AtomicReference<RestContext> context = new AtomicReference<>();
068   private AtomicReference<Exception> initException = new AtomicReference<>();
069
070   @Override /* Servlet */
071   public synchronized void init(ServletConfig servletConfig) throws ServletException {
072      try {
073         if (context.get() != null)
074            return;
075         super.init(servletConfig);
076         context.set(RestContext.create(this.getClass(), null, servletConfig).init(()->this).build());
077         context.get().postInit();
078         context.get().postInitChildFirst();
079      } catch (ServletException e) {
080         initException.set(e);
081         log(SEVERE, e, "Servlet init error on class ''{0}''", className(this));
082         throw e;
083      } catch (BasicHttpException e) {
084         initException.set(e);
085         log(SEVERE, e, "Servlet init error on class ''{0}''", className(this));
086      } catch (Throwable e) {
087         initException.set(new InternalServerError(e));
088         log(SEVERE, e, "Servlet init error on class ''{0}''", className(this));
089      }
090   }
091
092   /**
093    * Sets the context object for this servlet.
094    *
095    * <p>
096    * This method is effectively a no-op if {@link #init(ServletConfig)} has already been called.
097    *
098    * @param context Sets the context object on this servlet.
099    * @throws ServletException If error occurred during initialization.
100    */
101   protected void setContext(RestContext context) throws ServletException {
102      if (this.context.get() == null) {
103         super.init(context.getBuilder());
104         this.context.set(context);
105      }
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Returns the path for this resource as defined by the @Rest(path) annotation or RestContext.Builder.path(String) method
110    * concatenated with those on all parent classes.
111    *
112    * @return The path defined on this servlet, or an empty string if not specified.
113    */
114   public synchronized String getPath() {
115      RestContext context = this.context.get();
116      if (context != null)
117         return context.getFullPath();
118      ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(getClass());
119      Value<String> path = Value.empty();
120      ci.forEachAnnotation(Rest.class, x -> isNotEmpty(x.path()), x -> path.set(trimSlashes(x.path())));
121      return path.orElse("");
122   }
123
124   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
125   // Lifecycle methods
126   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
127
128   /**
129    * The main service method.
130    *
131    * <p>
132    * Subclasses can optionally override this method if they want to tailor the behavior of requests.
133    */
134   @Override /* Servlet */
135   public void service(HttpServletRequest r1, HttpServletResponse r2) throws ServletException, InternalServerError, IOException {
136      try {
137         if (initException.get() != null)
138            throw initException.get();
139         if (context.get() == null)
140            throw new InternalServerError("Servlet {0} not initialized.  init(ServletConfig) was not called.  This can occur if you've overridden this method but didn't call super.init(RestConfig).", className(this));
141         getContext().execute(this, r1, r2);
142
143      } catch (Throwable e) {
144         r2.sendError(SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, e.getLocalizedMessage());
145      }
146   }
147
148   @Override /* GenericServlet */
149   public synchronized void destroy() {
150      if (context.get() != null)
151         context.get().destroy();
152      super.destroy();
153   }
154
155   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
156   // Context methods.
157   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
158
159   /**
160    * Returns the read-only context object that contains all the configuration information about this resource.
161    *
162    * <p>
163    * This object is <jk>null</jk> during the call to {@link #init(ServletConfig)} but is populated by the time
164    * {@link #init()} is called.
165    *
166    * <p>
167    * Resource classes that don't extend from {@link RestServlet} can add the following method to their class to get
168    * access to this context object:
169    * <p class='bjava'>
170    *    <jk>public void</jk> init(RestServletContext <jv>context</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception;
171    * </p>
172    *
173    * @return The context information on this servlet.
174    */
175   public synchronized RestContext getContext() {
176      RestContext rc = context.get();
177      if (rc == null)
178         throw new InternalServerError("RestContext object not set on resource.");
179      return rc;
180   }
181
182   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
183   // Convenience logger methods
184   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
185
186   /**
187    * Log a message.
188    *
189    * <p>
190    * Subclasses can intercept the handling of these messages by overriding {@link #doLog(Level, Throwable, Supplier)}.
191    *
192    * @param level The log level.
193    * @param msg The message to log.
194    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
195    */
196   public void log(Level level, String msg, Object...args) {
197      doLog(level, null, () -> StringUtils.format(msg, args));
198   }
199
200   /**
201    * Log a message.
202    *
203    * <p>
204    * Subclasses can intercept the handling of these messages by overriding {@link #doLog(Level, Throwable, Supplier)}.
205    *
206    * @param level The log level.
207    * @param cause The cause.
208    * @param msg The message to log.
209    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
210    */
211   public void log(Level level, Throwable cause, String msg, Object...args) {
212      doLog(level, cause, () -> StringUtils.format(msg, args));
213   }
214
215   /**
216    * Main logger method.
217    *
218    * <p>
219    * The default behavior logs a message to the Java logger of the class name.
220    *
221    * <p>
222    * Subclasses can override this method to implement their own logger handling.
223    *
224    * @param level The log level.
225    * @param cause Optional throwable.
226    * @param msg The message to log.
227    */
228   protected void doLog(Level level, Throwable cause, Supplier<String> msg) {
229      RestContext c = context.get();
230      Logger logger = c == null ? null : c.getLogger();
231      if (logger == null)
232         logger = Logger.getLogger(className(this));
233      logger.log(level, cause, msg);
234   }
235
236   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
237   // Other methods
238   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
239
240   /**
241    * Returns the current thread-local HTTP request.
242    *
243    * @return The current thread-local HTTP request, or <jk>null</jk> if it wasn't created.
244    */
245   public synchronized RestRequest getRequest() {
246      return getContext().getLocalSession().getOpSession().getRequest();
247   }
248
249   /**
250    * Returns the current thread-local HTTP response.
251    *
252    * @return The current thread-local HTTP response, or <jk>null</jk> if it wasn't created.
253    */
254   public synchronized RestResponse getResponse() {
255      return getContext().getLocalSession().getOpSession().getResponse();
256   }
257}
